sub_title: Managing Director Europe at The HEINEKEN Company
summary: After having a career with the Bulgarian Consumer Cooperatives I joined the Coca-Cola Hellenic Bottling Company. Held a position in Business Development and engineered the establishment of the CCH JVs in Bulgaria and the acquisition of Zagorka and Ariana breweries by a JV between Heineken and CCH. Appointed General Manager of Zagorka/HEINEKEN Bulgaria in Feb 1995. During my ten-year tenure as a GM in Bulgaria I have build a new team and a profitable business while growing from a distant No.2 to undisputed market leadership. In 2005 moved to the Slovak Republic as Managing Director of HEINEKEN Slovakia, a business comprising of three companies - a malting, a brewing and a distribution one. Since 2005 the business has grown across all key dimensions: volume, market share and profit to a indisputable market leadership. As a result HEINEKEN Slovakia was awarded with the ‘HEINEKEN CEE Business Excellence Award 2007’. Since August 2008 appointed as Managing Director/CEO of HEINEKEN Russia where successfully defined the winning strategy and has been instrumental in rationalizing the cost base and successfully managed to deliver the financial and market share turn-around. Laureate of the “Top 1000 most professional managers of Russia” in 2009, 2010. In April 2013 appointed as Managing Director Central Europe. Effective 1-July 2015 appointed as Managing Director Europe in HEINEKEN. A proven track record in building successful brand portfolios and teams, and in growing talented managers. A Bulgarian national with a strong knowledge of English, Russian and Slovak. Married, a father of two children.
